intro: Maytenus trianae, commonly known as the Trianas mayten, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in humid, shaded environments within its native range.
